name: py-scipy
description:
SciPy (pronounced "Sigh Pie") is a Scientific Library for Python. It
provides many user-friendly and efficient numerical routines such as
routines for numerical integration and optimization.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-cython
dependencies.description: The Cython compiler for writing C extensions for the Python language.

dependencies.name: py-pybind11
dependencies.description:
pybind11 -- Seamless operability between C++11 and Python. pybind11 is a
lightweight header-only library that exposes C++ types in Python and
vice versa, mainly to create Python bindings of existing C++ code. Its
goals and syntax are similar to the excellent Boost.Python library by
David Abrahams: to minimize boilerplate code in traditional extension
modules by inferring type information using compile-time introspection.

dependencies.name: py-pythran
dependencies.description: Ahead of Time compiler for numeric kernels.

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description:
NumPy is the fundamental package for scientific computing with Python.
It contains among other things: a powerful N-dimensional array object,
sophisticated (broadcasting) functions, tools for integrating C/C++ and
Fortran code, and useful linear algebra, Fourier transform, and random
number capabilities

dependencies.name: py-pytest
dependencies.description: pytest: simple powerful testing with Python.

dependencies.name: blas
dependencies.description:
BLIS is a portable software framework for instantiating high-performance
BLAS-like dense linear algebra libraries. The framework was designed to
isolate essential kernels of computation that, when optimized,
immediately enable optimized implementations of most of its commonly
used and computationally intensive operations. BLIS is written in ISO
C99 and available under a new/modified/3-clause BSD license. While BLIS
exports a new BLAS-like API, it also includes a BLAS compatibility layer
which gives application developers access to BLIS implementations via
traditional BLAS routine calls. An object-based API unique to BLIS is
also available.

dependencies.name: lapack
dependencies.description:
The Cray Scientific Libraries package, LibSci, is a collection of
numerical routines optimized for best performance on Cray systems.

dependent_to.name: py-niworkflows
dependent_to.description: Common workflows for MRI (anatomical, functional, diffusion, etc)

dependent_to.name: py-biom-format
dependent_to.description:
The BIOM file format (canonically pronounced biome) is designed to be a
general-use format for representing biological sample by observation
contingency tables.

dependent_to.name: py-qsymm
dependent_to.description:
Qsymm is a symmetry finder and symmetric Hamiltonian generator. It
automatically generates model Hamiltonians from symmetry constraints and
finds the full symmetry group of your Hamiltonian.

dependent_to.name: nrm
dependent_to.description: Node Resource Manager

dependent_to.name: treelite
dependent_to.description:
Treelite is a model compiler for efficient deployment of decision tree
ensembles.

dependent_to.name: py-cnvkit
dependent_to.description: Copy number variation toolkit for high-throughput sequencing.

dependent_to.name: py-cvxpy
dependent_to.description: Convex optimization, for everyone.

dependent_to.name: py-yt
dependent_to.description:
Volumetric Data Analysis yt is a python package for analyzing and
visualizing volumetric, multi-resolution data from astrophysical
simulations, radio telescopes, and a burgeoning interdisciplinary
community.

dependent_to.name: py-metpy
dependent_to.description:
Collection of tools for reading, visualizing and performing calculations
with weather data.

dependent_to.name: py-nilearn
dependent_to.description: Statistical learning for neuroimaging in Python.

dependent_to.name: cantera
dependent_to.description:
Cantera is a suite of object-oriented software tools for problems
involving chemical kinetics, thermodynamics, and/or transport processes.

dependent_to.name: py-pot
dependent_to.description:
This open source Python library provide several solvers for
optimization problems related to Optimal Transport for signal, image
processing and machine learning.

dependent_to.name: uqtk
dependent_to.description:
Sandia Uncertainty Quantification Toolkit. The UQ Toolkit (UQTk) is a
collection of libraries and tools for the quantification of uncertainty
in numerical model predictions

dependent_to.name: py-carputils
dependent_to.description:
The carputils framework for running simulations with the openCARP
software.

dependent_to.name: py-pomegranate
dependent_to.description: Fast, flexible and easy to use probabilistic modelling in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-symfit
dependent_to.description: Symbolic Fitting; fitting as it should be.

dependent_to.name: py-mikado
dependent_to.description:
Mikado is a lightweight Python3 pipeline whose purpose is to facilitate
the identification of expressed loci from RNA-Seq data * and to select
the best models in each locus.

dependent_to.name: py-guiqwt
dependent_to.description:
guiqwt is a set of tools for curve and image plotting (extension to
PythonQwt)

dependent_to.name: py-pydoe
dependent_to.description:
The pyDOE package is designed to help the scientist, engineer,
statistician, etc., to construct appropriate experimental designs

dependent_to.name: partitionfinder
dependent_to.description:
PartitionFinder is free open source software to select best-fit
partitioning schemes and models of molecular evolution for phylogenetic
analyses.

dependent_to.name: py-autograd-gamma
dependent_to.description:
autograd compatible approximations to the derivatives of the Gamma-
family of functions.

dependent_to.name: py-paramz
dependent_to.description: The Parameterization Framework.

dependent_to.name: py-motmetrics
dependent_to.description:
The py-motmetrics library provides a Python implementation of metrics
for benchmarking multiple object trackers (MOT).

dependent_to.name: py-bayesian-optimization
dependent_to.description:
Pure Python implementation of bayesian global optimization with gaussian
processes.

dependent_to.name: py-gluoncv
dependent_to.description:
GluonCV provides implementations of state-of-the-art (SOTA) deep
learning algorithms in computer vision. It aims to help engineers,
researchers, and students quickly prototype products, validate new ideas
and learn computer vision.

dependent_to.name: py-tomopy
dependent_to.description:
TomoPy is an open-source Python package for tomographic data processing
and image reconstruction.

dependent_to.name: py-imgaug
dependent_to.description:
A library for image augmentation in machine learning experiments,
particularly convolutional neural networks. Supports the augmentation of
images, keypoints/landmarks, bounding boxes, heatmaps and segmentation
maps in a variety of different ways.

dependent_to.name: py-control
dependent_to.description:
The Python Control Systems Library is a Python module that implements
basic operations for analysis and design of feedback control systems.

dependent_to.name: py-glmnet
dependent_to.description:
This is a Python wrapper for the fortran library used in the R package
glmnet.

dependent_to.name: py-goatools
dependent_to.description: Python scripts to find enrichment of GO terms

dependent_to.name: py-mapclassify
dependent_to.description: Classification Schemes for Choropleth Maps.

dependent_to.name: py-geocube
dependent_to.description: Tool to convert geopandas vector data into rasterized xarray data.

dependent_to.name: py-librosa
dependent_to.description: A python package for music and audio analysis.

dependent_to.name: py-sncosmo
dependent_to.description: SNCosmo is a Python library for high-level supernova cosmology analysis.

dependent_to.name: py-dp-gp-cluster
dependent_to.description:
DP_GP_cluster clusters genes by expression over a time course using a
Dirichlet process Gaussian process model.

dependent_to.name: py-xgboost
dependent_to.description:
XGBoost is an optimized distributed gradient boosting library designed
to be highly efficient, flexible and portable.

dependent_to.name: py-neurokit2
dependent_to.description:
The Python Toolbox for Neurophysiological Signal Processing. This
package is the continuation of NeuroKit 1. It's a user-friendly package
providing easy access to advanced biosignal processing routines.
Researchers and clinicians without extensive knowledge of programming or
biomedical signal processing can analyze physiological data with only
two lines of code.

dependent_to.name: py-vcf-kit
dependent_to.description:
VCF-kit is a command-line based collection of utilities for performing
analysis on Variant Call Format (VCF) files.

dependent_to.name: py-pybrain
dependent_to.description: PyBrain is the Swiss army knife for neural networking.

dependent_to.name: py-cinemasci
dependent_to.description: A set of python tools for reading, writing and viewing Cinema databases

dependent_to.name: py-fury
dependent_to.description: Free Unified Rendering in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-tensorflow
dependent_to.description: TensorFlow is an Open Source Software Library for Machine Intelligence

dependent_to.name: py-pyamg
dependent_to.description:
PyAMG is a library of Algebraic Multigrid (AMG) solvers with a
convenient Python interface.

dependent_to.name: py-qiskit-terra
dependent_to.description:
Qiskit is an open-source SDK for working with quantum computers at the
level of extended quantum circuits, operators, and algorithms.

dependent_to.name: py-gensim
dependent_to.description:
Gensim is a Python library for topic modelling, document indexing and
similarity retrieval with large corpora. Target audience is the natural
language processing (NLP) and information retrieval (IR) community.

dependent_to.name: py-deeptools
dependent_to.description:
deepTools addresses the challenge of handling the large amounts of data
that are now routinely generated from DNA sequencing centers.

dependent_to.name: py-tpot
dependent_to.description:
A Python Automated Machine Learning tool that optimizes machine
learning pipelines using genetic programming.

dependent_to.name: py-python-fmask
dependent_to.description:
A set of command line utilities and Python modules that implement the
FMASK algorithm for Landsat and Sentinel-2

dependent_to.name: py-torch-geometric
dependent_to.description:
PyTorch Geometric (PyG) is a geometric deep learning extension library
for PyTorch. It consists of various methods for deep learning on graphs
and other irregular structures, also known as geometric deep learning,
from a variety of published papers. In addition, it consists of an easy-
to-use mini-batch loader for many small and single giant graphs, multi
gpu-support, a large number of common benchmark datasets (based on
simple interfaces to create your own), and helpful transforms, both for
learning on arbitrary graphs as well as on 3D meshes or point clouds.

dependent_to.name: py-mlxtend
dependent_to.description:
Mlxtend (machine learning extensions) is a Python library of useful
tools for the day-to-day data science tasks.

dependent_to.name: sirius
dependent_to.description: Domain specific library for electronic structure calculations

dependent_to.name: py-cuml
dependent_to.description:
cuML is a suite of libraries that implement machine learning algorithms
and mathematical primitives functions that share compatible APIs with
other RAPIDS projects.

dependent_to.name: py-pybids
dependent_to.description: bids: interface with datasets conforming to BIDS

dependent_to.name: py-smac
dependent_to.description:
SMAC is a tool for algorithm configuration to optimize the parameters of
arbitrary algorithms, including hyperparameter optimization of Machine
Learning algorithms.

dependent_to.name: py-gpytorch
dependent_to.description:
GPyTorch is a Gaussian process library implemented using PyTorch.
GPyTorch is designed for creating scalable, flexible, and modular
Gaussian process models with ease.

dependent_to.name: py-dgl
dependent_to.description:
Deep Graph Library (DGL). DGL is an easy-to-use, high performance and
scalable Python package for deep learning on graphs. DGL is framework
agnostic, meaning if a deep graph model is a component of an end-to-end
application, the rest of the logics can be implemented in any major
frameworks, such as PyTorch, Apache MXNet or TensorFlow.

dependent_to.name: py-wradlib
dependent_to.description:
wradlib is designed to assist you in the most important steps of
processing weather radar data. These may include: reading common data
formats, georeferencing, converting reflectivity to rainfall intensity,
identifying and correcting typical error sources (such as clutter or
attenuation) and visualising the data.

dependent_to.name: py-gpyopt
dependent_to.description:
Performs global optimization with different acquisition functions.
Among other functionalities, it is possible to use GPyOpt to optimize
physical experiments (sequentially or in batches) and tune the
parameters of Machine Learning algorithms. It is able to handle large
data sets via sparse Gaussian process models.

dependent_to.name: py-rsatoolbox
dependent_to.description: Representational Similarity Analysis (RSA) in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-brian
dependent_to.description: A clock-driven simulator for spiking neural networks

dependent_to.name: py-plotnine
dependent_to.description:
plotnine is an implementation of a grammar of graphics in Python, it is
based on ggplot2. The grammar allows users to compose plots by
explicitly mapping data to the visual objects that make up the plot.

dependent_to.name: py-lightgbm
dependent_to.description:
LightGBM is a gradient boosting framework that uses tree based learning
algorithms.

dependent_to.name: py-nitransforms
dependent_to.description: NiTransforms -- Neuroimaging spatial transforms in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-netket
dependent_to.description:
NetKet is an open-source project, delivering cutting-edge methods for
the study of many-body quantum systems with artificial neural networks
and machine learning techniques.

dependent_to.name: py-dask-glm
dependent_to.description:
Dask-glm is a library for fitting Generalized Linear Models on large
datasets.

dependent_to.name: py-pyani
dependent_to.description:
pyani is a Python3 module that provides support for calculating average
nucleotide identity (ANI) and related measures for whole genome
comparisons, and rendering relevant graphical summary output. Where
available, it takes advantage of multicore systems, and can integrate
with SGE/OGE-type job schedulers for the sequence comparisons.

dependent_to.name: py-pyheadtail
dependent_to.description:
CERN PyHEADTAIL numerical n-body simulation code for simulating macro-
particle beam dynamics with collective effects.

dependent_to.name: py-mg-rast-tools
dependent_to.description:
Repository of scripts and libraries for using the MG-RAST API and MG-
RAST data.

dependent_to.name: py-projectq
dependent_to.description:
ProjectQ is an open-source software framework for quantum computing
started at ETH Zurich. It allows users to implement their quantum
programs in Python using a powerful and intuitive syntax. ProjectQ can
then translate these programs to any type of back-end, be it a simulator
run on a classical computer of an actual quantum chip.

dependent_to.name: py-gpy
dependent_to.description: The Gaussian Process Toolbox.

dependent_to.name: py-hyperopt
dependent_to.description:
Hyperopt is a Python library for serial and parallel optimization over
awkward search spaces, which may include real-valued, discrete, and
conditional dimensions.

dependent_to.name: py-ecos
dependent_to.description: This is the Python package for ECOS: Embedded Cone Solver.

dependent_to.name: py-sfepy
dependent_to.description:
SfePy (https://sfepy.org/) is a software for solving systems of coupled
partial differential equations (PDEs) by the finite element method in
1D, 2D and 3D. It can be viewed both as black-box PDE solver, and as a
Python package which can be used for building custom applications.

dependent_to.name: py-gemini
dependent_to.description:
GEMINI (GEnome MINIng) is a flexible framework for exploring genetic
variation in the context of the wealth of genome annotations available
for the human genome.

dependent_to.name: sgpp
dependent_to.description:
SGpp is a library and framework for sparse grids in different flavors.
SGpp supports both hierarchical spatially-adaptive sparse grids and the
dimensionally-adaptive sparse grid combination technique.

dependent_to.name: py-pyugrid
dependent_to.description: Work with triangular unstructured grids and the data on them.

dependent_to.name: py-fits-tools
dependent_to.description:
Tools for manipulating FITS images using primarily scipy & native python
routines

dependent_to.name: py-keras
dependent_to.description:
Deep Learning library for Python. Convnets, recurrent neural networks,
and more. Runs on Theano or TensorFlow.

dependent_to.name: isescan
dependent_to.description:
A python pipeline to identify IS (Insertion Sequence) elements in genome
and metagenome

dependent_to.name: py-glmsingle
dependent_to.description: A toolbox for accurate single-trial estimates in fMRI time-series data.

dependent_to.name: py-dask-ml
dependent_to.description: Scalable Machine Learning with Dask.

dependent_to.name: py-ase
dependent_to.description:
The Atomic Simulation Environment (ASE) is a set of tools and Python
modules for setting up, manipulating, running, visualizing and analyzing
atomistic simulations.

dependent_to.name: py-pymc3
dependent_to.description:
PyMC3 is a Python package for Bayesian statistical modeling and
Probabilistic Machine Learning focusing on advanced Markov chain Monte
Carlo (MCMC) and variational inference (VI) algorithms. Its flexibility
and extensibility make it applicable to a large suite of problems.

dependent_to.name: py-sdmetrics
dependent_to.description:
The SDMetrics library provides a set of dataset-agnostic tools for
evaluating the quality of a synthetic database by comparing it to the
real database that it is modeled after.

dependent_to.name: py-convokit
dependent_to.description:
This toolkit contains tools to extract conversational features and
analyze social phenomena in conversations, using a single unified
interface inspired by (and compatible with) scikit-learn.

dependent_to.name: py-abcpy
dependent_to.description:
ABCpy is a highly modular, scientific library for approximate Bayesian
computation (ABC) written in Python. It is designed to run all included
ABC algorithms in parallel, either using multiple cores of a single
computer or using an Apache Spark or MPI enabled cluster.

dependent_to.name: py-cartopy
dependent_to.description: Cartopy - a cartographic python library with matplotlib support.

dependent_to.name: spectre
dependent_to.description:
The SpECTRE numerical relativity code. SpECTRE is an open-source code
for multi-scale, multi-physics problems in astrophysics and
gravitational physics. In the future, we hope that it can be applied to
problems across discipline boundaries in fluid dynamics, geoscience,
plasma physics, nuclear physics, and engineering. It runs at petascale
and is designed for future exascale computers. SpECTRE is being
developed in support of our collaborative Simulating eXtreme Spacetimes
(SXS) research program into the multi-messenger astrophysics of neutron
star mergers, core-collapse supernovae, and gamma-ray bursts.

dependent_to.name: py-pycortex
dependent_to.description: Python Cortical mapping software for fMRI data.

dependent_to.name: py-pylops
dependent_to.description:
Many useful operators, however, do not lend themselves to an explicit
matrix representation when used to solve large-scale problems. PyLops
operators, on the other hand, still represent a matrix and can be
treated in a similar way, but do not rely on the explicit creation of a
dense (or sparse) matrix itself. Conversely, the forward and adjoint
operators are represented by small pieces of codes that mimic the effect
of the matrix on a vector or another matrix.

dependent_to.name: py-visdom
dependent_to.description:
Visdom aims to facilitate visualization of (remote) data with an
emphasis on supporting scientific experimentation.

dependent_to.name: py-lineenhancer
dependent_to.description: The line enhancer is only used by crYOLO internally

dependent_to.name: py-lhsmdu
dependent_to.description:
Latin Hypercube Sampling with Multi-Dimensional Uniformity (LHS-MDU)
from Deutsch and Deutsch, Latin hypercube sampling with multidimensional
uniformity.

dependent_to.name: py-numpy-quaternion
dependent_to.description:
This package creates a quaternion type in python, and further enables
numpy to create and manipulate arrays of quaternions. The usual
algebraic operations (addition and multiplication) are available, along
with numerous properties like norm and various types of distance
measures between two quaternions. There are also additional functions
like "squad" and "slerp" interpolation, and conversions to and from
axis-angle, matrix, and Euler-angle representations of rotations. The
core of the code is written in C for speed.

dependent_to.name: lvarray
dependent_to.description: LvArray portable HPC containers.

dependent_to.name: py-nipype
dependent_to.description: Neuroimaging in Python: Pipelines and Interfaces.

dependent_to.name: faiss
dependent_to.description:
Faiss is a library for efficient similarity search and clustering of
dense vectors. Faiss contains algorithms that search in sets of vectors
of any size, up to ones that possibly do not fit in RAM. It also
contains supporting code for evaluation and parameter tuning. Faiss is
written in C++ with complete wrappers for Python/numpy. Some of the most
useful algorithms are implemented on the GPU. It is developed by
Facebook AI Research.

dependent_to.name: py-networkit
dependent_to.description:
NetworKit is a growing open-source toolkit for large-scale network
analysis. Its aim is to provide tools for the analysis of large networks
in the size range from thousands to billions of edges. For this purpose,
it implements efficient graph algorithms, many of them parallel to
utilize multicore architectures. These are meant to compute standard
measures of network analysis, such as degree sequences, clustering
coefficients, and centrality measures. In this respect, NetworKit is
comparable to packages such as NetworkX, albeit with a focus on
parallelism and scalability.

dependent_to.name: py-nistats
dependent_to.description: Modeling and Statistical analysis of fMRI data in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-picmistandard
dependent_to.description: Standard input format for Particle-In-Cell codes

dependent_to.name: py-botorch
dependent_to.description: BoTorch is a library for Bayesian Optimization built on PyTorch.

dependent_to.name: py-gym
dependent_to.description:
OpenAI Gym is a toolkit for developing and comparing reinforcement
learning algorithms. This is the gym open-source library, which gives
you access to a standardized set of environments.

dependent_to.name: py-pymatgen
dependent_to.description:
Python Materials Genomics is a robust materials analysis code that
defines core object representations for structures and molecules with
support for many electronic structure codes. It is currently the core
analysis code powering the Materials Project.

dependent_to.name: py-opppy
dependent_to.description:
The Output Parse-Plot Python (OPPPY) library is a python based data
analysis library designed to extract, store, and plot information from
output and dump files generated by scientific software packages.

dependent_to.name: py-pydmd
dependent_to.description:
PyDMD is a Python package that uses Dynamic Mode Decomposition for a
data-driven model simplification based on spatiotemporal coherent
structures.

dependent_to.name: alps
dependent_to.description:
Algorithms for Physics Simulations Tags: Condensed Matter Physics,
Computational Physics

dependent_to.name: orthofiller
dependent_to.description:
OrthoFiller: Identifying missing annotations for evolutionarily
conserved genes.

dependent_to.name: py-torch-cluster
dependent_to.description:
This package consists of a small extension library of highly optimized
graph cluster algorithms for the use in PyTorch.

dependent_to.name: py-patsy
dependent_to.description:
A Python package for describing statistical models and for building
design matrices.

dependent_to.name: py-copulas
dependent_to.description:
Copulas is a Python library for modeling multivariate distributions and
sampling from them using copula functions. Given a table containing
numerical data, we can use Copulas to learn the distribution and later
on generate new synthetic rows following the same statistical
properties.

dependent_to.name: py-misopy
dependent_to.description:
MISO (Mixture of Isoforms) is a probabilistic framework that quantitates
the expression level of alternatively spliced genes from RNA-Seq data,
and identifies differentially regulated isoforms or exons across
samples.

dependent_to.name: py-theano
dependent_to.description:
Optimizing compiler for evaluating mathematical expressions on CPUs and
GPUs.

dependent_to.name: py-torch-sparse
dependent_to.description:
This package consists of a small extension library of optimized sparse
matrix operations with autograd support.

dependent_to.name: cosmomc
dependent_to.description:
CosmoMC is a Fortran 2008 Markov-Chain Monte-Carlo (MCMC) engine for
exploring cosmological parameter space, together with Fortran and python
code for analysing Monte-Carlo samples and importance sampling (plus a
suite of scripts for building grids of runs, plotting and presenting
results).

dependent_to.name: py-spykeutils
dependent_to.description: Utilities for analyzing electrophysiological data

dependent_to.name: py-pyscf
dependent_to.description:
PySCF is a collection of electronic structure programs powered by
Python.

dependent_to.name: py-gpaw
dependent_to.description:
GPAW is a density-functional theory (DFT) Python code based on the
projector-augmented wave (PAW) method and the atomic simulation
environment (ASE).

dependent_to.name: py-pyfr
dependent_to.description:
PyFR is an open-source Python based framework for solving advection-
diffusion type problems on streaming architectures using the Flux
Reconstruction approach of Huynh.

dependent_to.name: py-dxchange
dependent_to.description:
DXchange provides an interface with tomoPy and raw tomographic data
collected at different synchrotron facilities.

dependent_to.name: py-scikit-learn-extra
dependent_to.description:
A set of useful tools compatible with scikit-learn scikit-learn-extra is
a Python module for machine learning that extends scikit-learn. It
includes algorithms that are useful but do not satisfy the scikit-learn
inclusion criteria, for instance due to their novelty or lower citation
number.

dependent_to.name: py-python-picard
dependent_to.description: Preconditoned ICA for Real Data.

dependent_to.name: py-deepsig
dependent_to.description:
deep-significance: Easy and Better Significance Testing for Deep Neural
Networks

dependent_to.name: py-ucsf-pyem
dependent_to.description:
UCSF pyem is a collection of Python modules and command-line utilities
for electron microscopy of biological samples.

dependent_to.name: py-libensemble
dependent_to.description: Library for managing ensemble-like collections of computations.

dependent_to.name: py-scikit-fuzzy
dependent_to.description: Fuzzy logic toolkit for SciPy

dependent_to.name: hic-pro
dependent_to.description:
HiC-Pro is a package designed to process Hi-C data, from raw fastq files
(paired-end Illumina data) to the normalized contact maps

dependent_to.name: py-reproject
dependent_to.description:
The reproject package is a Python package to reproject astronomical
images using various techniques via a uniform interface. By
reprojection, we mean the re-gridding of images from one world
coordinate system to another (for example changing the pixel resolution,
orientation, coordinate system). Currently, we have implemented
reprojection of celestial images by interpolation (like SWARP), as well
as by finding the exact overlap between pixels on the celestial sphere
(like Montage). It can also reproject to/from HEALPIX projections by
relying on the astropy-healpix package.

dependent_to.name: py-rioxarray
dependent_to.description: rasterio xarray extension.

dependent_to.name: py-mne
dependent_to.description: MNE python project for MEG and EEG data analysis.

dependent_to.name: nest
dependent_to.description:
NEST is a simulator for spiking neural network models It focuses on the
dynamics, size and structure of neural systems rather than on the exact
morphology of individual neurons.

dependent_to.name: py-filterpy
dependent_to.description:
This library provides Kalman filtering and various related optimal and
non-optimal filtering software written in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-cdo
dependent_to.description:
The cdo package provides an interface to the Climate Data Operators from
Python.

dependent_to.name: py-spgl1
dependent_to.description:
SPGL1 is a solver for large-scale one-norm regularized least squares. It
is designed to solve any of the following three problems: Basis pursuit
denoise (BPDN): minimize ||x||_1 subject to ||Ax - b||_2 <= sigma, Basis
pursuit (BP): minimize ||x||_1 subject to Ax = b Lasso: minimize ||Ax -
b||_2 subject to ||x||_1 <= tau, The matrix A can be defined explicitly,
or as an operator that returns both both Ax and A'b. SPGL1 can solve
these three problems in both the real and complex domains.

dependent_to.name: reditools
dependent_to.description:
REDItools: python scripts for RNA editing detection by RNA-Seq data.
REDItools are simple python scripts conceived to facilitate the
investigation of RNA editing at large-scale and devoted to research
groups that would to explore such phenomenon in own data but don't have
sufficient bioinformatics skills. They work on main operating systems
(although unix/linux-based OS are preferred), can handle reads from
whatever platform in the standard BAM format and implement a variety of
filters.

dependent_to.name: py-scs
dependent_to.description: SCS: splitting conic solver

dependent_to.name: py-statsmodels
dependent_to.description: Statistical computations and models for use with SciPy

dependent_to.name: py-umi-tools
dependent_to.description: Tools for handling Unique Molecular Identifiers in NGS data sets

dependent_to.name: py-pysurfer
dependent_to.description: Cortical neuroimaging visualization in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-arviz
dependent_to.description:
ArviZ (pronounced "AR-vees") is a Python package for exploratory
analysis of Bayesian models. Includes functions for posterior analysis,
model checking, comparison and diagnostics.

dependent_to.name: py-py6s
dependent_to.description:
A wrapper for the 6S Radiative Transfer Model to make it easy to run
simulations with a variety of input parameters, and to produce outputs
in an easily processable form.

dependent_to.name: pfapack
dependent_to.description:
A library for numerically computing the Pfaffian of a real or complex
skew-symmetric matrix. This is based on computing the tridiagonal form
of the matrix under unitary congruence transformations.

dependent_to.name: py-kmodes
dependent_to.description:
Python implementations of the k-modes and k-prototypes clustering
algorithms for clustering categorical data.

dependent_to.name: py-seaborn
dependent_to.description:
Seaborn: statistical data visualization. Seaborn is a library for making
attractive and informative statistical graphics in Python. It is built
on top of matplotlib and tightly integrated with the PyData stack,
including support for numpy and pandas data structures and statistical
routines from scipy and statsmodels.

dependent_to.name: py-labours
dependent_to.description: Python module dependency visualization.

dependent_to.name: py-openmc
dependent_to.description:
OpenMC is a community-developed Monte Carlo neutron and photon transport
simulation code. It is capable of performing fixed source, k-eigenvalue,
and subcritical multiplication calculations on models built using either
a constructive solid geometry or CAD representation. OpenMC supports
both continuous-energy and multigroup transport. The continuous-energy
particle interaction data is based on a native HDF5 format that can be
generated from ACE files produced by NJOY. Parallelism is enabled via a
hybrid MPI and OpenMP programming model.

dependent_to.name: salome-medcoupling
dependent_to.description:
salome-medcoupling is a part of SALOME platform to manipulate meshes and
fields in memory, and use salome-med format for files.

dependent_to.name: py-lifelines
dependent_to.description:
Survival analysis was originally developed and applied heavily by the
actuarial and medical community. Its purpose was to answer *why do
events occur now versus later* under uncertainty (where *events* might
refer to deaths, disease remission, etc.). *lifelines* is a pure Python
implementation of the best parts of survival analysis.

dependent_to.name: py-pygps
dependent_to.description:
pyGPs is a Python library for Gaussian Process (GP) Regression and
Classification.

dependent_to.name: py-nestle
dependent_to.description: Nested sampling algorithms for evaluating Bayesian evidence.

dependent_to.name: py-dh-scikit-optimize
dependent_to.description:
A Modified version of scikit-optimize a Sequential model-based
optimization toolbox for DeepHyper. Scikit-Optimize, or skopt, is a
simple and efficient library to minimize (very) expensive and noisy
black-box functions. It implements several methods for sequential model-
based optimization. skopt aims to be accessible and easy to use in many
contexts. The library is built on top of NumPy, SciPy and Scikit-Learn.

dependent_to.name: py-healpy
dependent_to.description: healpy is a Python package to handle pixelated data on the sphere.

dependent_to.name: py-pybobyqa
dependent_to.description:
Py-BOBYQA is a flexible package for solving bound-constrained general
objective minimization, without requiring derivatives of the objective.

dependent_to.name: gatetools
dependent_to.description: Python tools for GATE, see https://github.com/OpenGATE/Gate

dependent_to.name: py-scikit-optimize
dependent_to.description:
Scikit-Optimize, or skopt, is a simple and efficient library to minimize
(very) expensive and noisy black-box functions. It implements several
methods for sequential model-based optimization. skopt aims to be
accessible and easy to use in many contexts. The library is built on top
of NumPy, SciPy and Scikit-Learn.

dependent_to.name: sparta
dependent_to.description:
small RNA-PARE Target Analyzer (sPARTA) is a tool which utilizes high-
throughput sequencing to profile genome-wide cleavage products.

dependent_to.name: py-scikit-learn
dependent_to.description: A set of python modules for machine learning and data mining.

dependent_to.name: py-thirdorder
dependent_to.description: It helps ShengBTE users create FORCE_CONSTANTS_3RD files efficiently

dependent_to.name: py-anuga
dependent_to.description:
ANUGA (pronounced "AHnooGAH") is open-source software for the simulation
of the shallow water equation, in particular it can be used to model
tsunamis and floods.

dependent_to.name: py-dadi
dependent_to.description:
Fit population genetic models of demography and selection using
diffusion approximations to the allele frequency spectrum

dependent_to.name: py-pydoe2
dependent_to.description:
pyDOE2 is a fork of the pyDOE package that is designed to help the
scientist, engineer, statistician, etc., to construct appropriate
experimental designs.

dependent_to.name: py-phonopy
dependent_to.description:
Phonopy is an open source package for phonon calculations at harmonic
and quasi-harmonic levels.

dependent_to.name: py-openpmd-viewer
dependent_to.description: Python visualization tools for openPMD files

dependent_to.name: py-qiskit-aer
dependent_to.description:
Aer is a high performance simulator for quantum circuits that includes
noise models

dependent_to.name: py-salib
dependent_to.description: Python implementations of commonly used sensitivity analysis methods.

dependent_to.name: octa
dependent_to.description: OCTA is an integrated simulation system for soft materials.

dependent_to.name: py-xarray
dependent_to.description: N-D labeled arrays and datasets in Python

dependent_to.name: py-osqp
dependent_to.description: OSQP: The Operator Splitting QP Solver

dependent_to.name: py-astropy
dependent_to.description:
The Astropy Project is a community effort to develop a single core
package for Astronomy in Python and foster interoperability between
Python astronomy packages.

dependent_to.name: py-checkm-genome
dependent_to.description:
Assess the quality of microbial genomes recovered from isolates, single
cells, and metagenomes

dependent_to.name: py-syned
dependent_to.description:
A python library to define the components of a synchrotron beamline and
their positions. They can be read/write to json files. It is used by
OASYS as a common tool to define sources and optical systems that are
then exported to the different add-ons.

dependent_to.name: py-localcider
dependent_to.description: Tools for calculating sequence properties of disordered proteins

dependent_to.name: py-lws
dependent_to.description: Fast spectrogram phase recovery using Local Weighted Sums

dependent_to.name: py-pyts
dependent_to.description:
pyts is a Python package for time series classification. It aims to make
time series classification easily accessible by providing preprocessing
and utility tools, and implementations of state-of-the-art algorithms.
Most of these algorithms transform time series, thus pyts provides
several tools to perform these transformations.

dependent_to.name: py-abipy
dependent_to.description: Python package to automate ABINIT calculations and analyze the results.

dependent_to.name: py-damask
dependent_to.description: Pre- and post-processing tools for DAMASK

dependent_to.name: py-hdbscan
dependent_to.description:
HDBSCAN - Hierarchical Density-Based Spatial Clustering of Applications
with Noise. Performs DBSCAN over varying epsilon values and integrates
the result to find a clustering that gives the best stability over
epsilon. This allows HDBSCAN to find clusters of varying densities
(unlike DBSCAN), and be more robust to parameter selection. In practice
this means that HDBSCAN returns a good clustering straight away with
little or no parameter tuning -- and the primary parameter, minimum
cluster size, is intuitive and easy to select. HDBSCAN is ideal for
exploratory data analysis; it's a fast and robust algorithm that you can
trust to return meaningful clusters (if there are any).

dependent_to.name: py-dipy
dependent_to.description:
Diffusion MRI utilities in python. DIPY is the paragon 3D/4D+ imaging
library in Python. Contains generic methods for spatial normalization,
signal processing, machine learning, statistical analysis and
visualization of medical images. Additionally, it contains specialized
methods for computational anatomy including diffusion, perfusion and
structural imaging.

dependent_to.name: py-sparse
dependent_to.description: This library provides multi-dimensional sparse arrays.

dependent_to.name: py-yahmm
dependent_to.description: YAHMM is a HMM package for Python, implemented in Cython for speed.

dependent_to.name: py-elephant
dependent_to.description: Elephant is a package for analysis of electrophysiology data in Python

dependent_to.name: py-neurora
dependent_to.description: A Python Toolbox for Multimodal Neural Data Representation Analysis.

dependent_to.name: py-getorganelle
dependent_to.description: Organelle Genome Assembly Toolkit (Chloroplast/Mitocondrial/ITS)

dependent_to.name: py-torchgeo
dependent_to.description:
TorchGeo: datasets, transforms, and models for geospatial data. TorchGeo
is a PyTorch domain library, similar to torchvision, that provides
datasets, transforms, samplers, and pre-trained models specific to
geospatial data.

dependent_to.name: py-pspamm
dependent_to.description: Code Generator for Small Sparse Matrix Multiplication

dependent_to.name: py-fastai
dependent_to.description:
You can use fastai without any installation by using Google Colab. In
fact, every page of this documentation is also available as an
interactive notebook - click "Open in colab" at the top of any page to
open it (be sure to change the Colab runtime to "GPU" to have it run
fast!) See the fast.ai documentation on Using Colab for more
information.

dependent_to.name: py-formulaic
dependent_to.description:
Formulaic is a high-performance implementation of Wilkinson formulas for
Python.

dependent_to.name: py-sobol-seq
dependent_to.description: Sobol sequence implementation in python

dependent_to.name: py-meldmd
dependent_to.description:
MELD is a tool for inferring the structure of biomolecules from sparse,
ambiguous, or noisy data.

dependent_to.name: akantu
dependent_to.description:
Akantu means a little element in Kinyarwanda, a Bantu language. From
now on it is also an opensource object-oriented Finite Element library
which has the ambition to be generic and efficient.

dependent_to.name: py-pycbc
dependent_to.description:
PyCBC is a software package used to explore astrophysical sources of
gravitational waves. It contains algorithms to analyze gravitational-
wave data from the LIGO and Virgo detectors, detect coalescing compact
binaries, and measure the astrophysical parameters of detected sources.
PyCBC was used in the first direct detection of gravitational waves and
is used in the flagship analysis of LIGO and Virgo data.

dependent_to.name: py-intensity-normalization
dependent_to.description: Normalize intensities of images from various MRI modalities

dependent_to.name: pagmo
dependent_to.description:
Parallel Global Multiobjective Optimizer (and its Python alter ego
PyGMO) is a C++ / Python platform to perform parallel computations of
optimisation tasks (global and local) via the asynchronous generalized
island model.

dependent_to.name: py-rdt
dependent_to.description:
RDT is a Python library used to transform data for data science
libraries and preserve the transformations in order to revert them as
needed.

dependent_to.name: py-resampy
dependent_to.description: Efficient sample rate conversion in python

dependent_to.name: callflow
dependent_to.description:
CallFlow is an interactive visual analysis tool that provides a high-
level overview of CCTs together with semantic refinement operations to
progressively explore the CCTs.

dependent_to.name: py-pydv
dependent_to.description:
PDV is a 1D graphics and data analysis tool, heavily based on the ULTRA
plotting tool

dependent_to.name: py-lmfit
dependent_to.description: Least-Squares Minimization with Bounds and Constraints

dependent_to.name: py-pypulse
dependent_to.description:
Pulse is a package used to handle PSRFITS files and perform subsequent
analyses on pulse profiles.

dependent_to.name: py-quaternionic
dependent_to.description: Interpret numpy arrays as quaternionic arrays with numba acceleration

dependent_to.name: py-pyrad
dependent_to.description: RADseq for phylogenetics & introgression analyses

dependent_to.name: py-python-meep
dependent_to.description:
Python-meep is a wrapper around libmeep. It allows the scripting of
Meep-simulations with Python

dependent_to.name: py-hist
dependent_to.description: Hist classes and utilities

dependent_to.name: orthofinder
dependent_to.description:
OrthoFinder is a fast, accurate and comprehensive analysis tool for
comparative genomics. It finds orthologues and orthogroups infers rooted
gene trees for all orthogroups and infers a rooted species tree for the
species being analysed. OrthoFinder also provides comprehensive
statistics for comparative genomic analyses. OrthoFinder is simple to
use and all you need to run it is a set of protein sequence files (one
per species) in FASTA format.

dependent_to.name: py-ci-sdr
dependent_to.description:
This repository contains an implementation for the Convolutive transfer
function Invariant Signal-to-Distortion Ratio objective for PyTorch as
described in the publication Convolutive Transfer Function Invariant SDR
training criteria for Multi-Channel Reverberant Speech Separation

dependent_to.name: py-skl2onnx
dependent_to.description: Convert scikit-learn models to ONNX

dependent_to.name: dsqss
dependent_to.description:
DSQSS is a program package for solving quantum many-body problems
defined on lattices. It is based on the quantum Monte Carlo method in
Feynman's path integral representation.

dependent_to.name: py-hep-ml
dependent_to.description: Machine Learning for High Energy Physics

dependent_to.name: tamaas
dependent_to.description:
Tamaas is a C++ library with a Python interface that efficiently solves
contact mechanics problems with periodic rough surfaces, plasticity,
adhesion and friction.

dependent_to.name: py-mdanalysis
dependent_to.description:
MDAnalysis is a Python toolkit to analyze molecular dynamics
trajectories generated by a wide range of popular simulation packages
including DL_Poly, CHARMM, Amber, NAMD, LAMMPS, and Gromacs. (See the
lists of supported trajectory formats and topology formats.)

dependent_to.name: py-hpbandster
dependent_to.description:
A distributed Hyperband implementation with lots of room for
improvement

dependent_to.name: py-scikit-image
dependent_to.description:
Image processing algorithms for SciPy, including IO, morphology,
filtering, warping, color manipulation, object detection, etc.
